info.title: Apteco API
info.description: An API to allow access to Apteco Marketing Suite resources

get.summary: Returns version information about the API
Returns information about the current language the API is operating in (based on details in the request)
Requires OrbitAdmin: Returns details about the API's .Net process
get.description: This endpoint is only available for users with the OrbitAdmin role

403.description: The user isn't an admin user

post.summary: Requires OrbitAdmin: Forces a garbage collection in the API's process and then returns details about the API's .Net process
post.description: This endpoint is only available for users with the OrbitAdmin role

403.description: The user isn't an admin user

get.summary: Get the list of DataViews that are available.

parameters.name: filter
parameters.description: Filter the list of items using a simple expression language.  The available list of fields are Name

parameters.name: orderBy
parameters.description: Order the items by a given field (in ascending order unless the field is preceeded by a "-" character).  The available list of fields are Name

parameters.name: offset
parameters.description: The number of items to skip in the (potentially filtered) result set before returning subsequent items.

parameters.name: count
parameters.description: The maximum number of items to show from the (potentially filtered) result set.

400.description: The API has been configured not to return DataViews

get.summary: Get details for a particular DataView.

parameters.name: dataViewName
parameters.description: The name of the DataView to act on

400.description: The specified DataView is not the one you are currently logged in to and you are not an admin user

403.description: Forbidden

404.description: The specified DataView can't be found

get.summary: Get the list of DataViews that are available to users with the specified email domain.

parameters.name: domain
parameters.description: The email domain to list DataViews for (i.e. "example.com")

parameters.name: filter
parameters.description: Filter the list of items using a simple expression language.  The available list of fields are Name

parameters.name: orderBy
parameters.description: Order the items by a given field (in ascending order unless the field is preceeded by a "-" character).  The available list of fields are Name

parameters.name: offset
parameters.description: The number of items to skip in the (potentially filtered) result set before returning subsequent items.

parameters.name: count
parameters.description: The maximum number of items to show from the (potentially filtered) result set.

400.description: The API has been configured not to return DataViews

get.summary: Get the list of DataViews that are configured with the given FastStats system.

parameters.name: systemName
parameters.description: The name of the system to list DataViews for (i.e. "holidays")

parameters.name: filter
parameters.description: Filter the list of items using a simple expression language.  The available list of fields are Name

parameters.name: orderBy
parameters.description: Order the items by a given field (in ascending order unless the field is preceeded by a "-" character).  The available list of fields are Name

parameters.name: offset
parameters.description: The number of items to skip in the (potentially filtered) result set before returning subsequent items.

parameters.name: count
parameters.description: The maximum number of items to show from the (potentially filtered) result set.

400.description: The API has been configured not to return DataViews

get.description: EXPERIMENTAL

get.summary: Returns details of all the endpoints in the API

parameters.name: excludeEndpointsWithNoLicenceRequirements
parameters.description: If specified, don't return endpoints in the output that have no licence requirements.  Defaults to false - returns all endpoints

parameters.name: excludeEndpointsWithNoRoleRequirements
parameters.description: If specified, don't return endpoints in the output that have no role requirements.  Defaults to false - returns all endpoints

parameters.name: filter
parameters.description: Filter the list of items using a simple expression language.  The available list of fields are Name, GroupName, Method, UrlTemplate

parameters.name: orderBy
parameters.description: Order the items by a given field (in ascending order unless the field is preceeded by a "-" character).  The available list of fields are Name, GroupName, Method, UrlTemplate

parameters.name: offset
parameters.description: The number of items to skip in the (potentially filtered) result set before returning subsequent items.

parameters.name: count
parameters.description: The maximum number of items to show from the (potentially filtered) result set.

200.description: Details of all the endpoints in the API

parameters.name: orderBy
parameters.description: Order the items by a given field (in ascending order unless the field is preceeded by a "-" character).  The available list of fields are Id, SystemName, Title, Description, OwnerUsername, CreatedOn, DeletedOn, ResolveTableName, LastUpdatedUsername, LastUpdatedOn

post.summary: Creates a new audience from the given details for the logged in user.

parameters.name: dataViewName
parameters.description: The name of the DataView to act on

parameters.name: audienceDetail
parameters.description:
The details for the audience to create.  If you want
            to update a specific audience then PUT to the /Audiences/{audienceId} URL

404.description: The DataView couldn't be found

get.summary: Returns the details of a particular audience

parameters.name: dataViewName
parameters.description: The name of the DataView to act on

parameters.name: audienceId
parameters.description: The id of the audience to view

parameters.name: includeQueries
parameters.description: If specified, whether to include the query definitions for this audience or not.  Defaults to true - to return query definitions

parameters.name: includeBrief
parameters.description: If specified, whether to include the brief for this audience or not.  Defaults to true - to return the brief

403.description: The given session is not allowed to see the details for this audience

404.description: The audience or DataView couldn't be found

parameters.description: The name of the DataView to act on

post.summary: Transfer ownership of an audience from the current user to a new owner

parameters.name: dataViewName
parameters.description: The name of the DataView to act on

parameters.name: audienceId
parameters.description: The id of the audience to transfer.

parameters.name: transferOwnershipDetails
parameters.description: The details for transferring ownership of the audience.

parameters.name: includeQueries
parameters.description: If specified, whether to include the query definitions for the returned audience or not.  Defaults to true - to return query definitions

parameters.name: includeBrief
parameters.description: If specified, whether to include the brief for this audience or not.  Defaults to true - to return the brief

200.description: The ownership of the audience was successfully transferred

403.description: The given session is not allowed to transfer this audience.  Only audience owners can transfer their audiences

post.summary:

and/or as a sample within the body of the result

measures.description: The measures to build the cube with.  This can be one or more aggregations to calculate for the specified dimensions such as counts, sums, means, etc.

Measure.description: A measure to define the figures shown for each cell created by the dimensions of the cube

resolveTableName.description: The name of the table to resolve this measure to.  I.e. all the counts in this measure will be counts of entities from this table

function.description: The function to use to aggregate up the data per cell within this measure

variableName.description: If the measure is based on a variable then the name of the variable to use

query.description: If the measure is based on a query - the definition of the query to use

filterQuery.description: A query used to filter the records for each cell in this measure

expression.description: If the measure is based on an expression then the expression to use

sort.description: How the cells are sorted in this measure

CubeResult.description: Results for processing a cube request

title.description: The title of the cube that has been calculated

notes.description: Any notes associated with the query that has been counted

ranSuccessfully.description: Whether the query was counted successfully or not

systemName.description: The name of the FastStats system that this count has been produced by

systemLoadDate.description: The date and time that the FastStats system from which this count has come was last built

userName.description: The name of the user that requested this count

runDate.description: The date and time that this count was run on

queryDescription.description: A textual description of the query that was counted

dimensionResults.description: The set of dimension results for this cube, containing the category codes and descriptions for each dimension in the cube

measureResults.description: The set of measure results for this cube, containing the values for each measure in the cube

cube.description: The definition of the cube that was requested.

counts.description: A list of counts for each affected table in the FastStats system.  The first count in the list is the main one.

DimensionResult.description: The results returned for a dimension defined in the cube

headerCodes.description: A set of tab-delimited codes, one for each category in the dimension

headerDescriptions.description: A set of tab-delimited descriptions, one for each category in the dimension

MeasureResult.description: The results returned for a measure defined in the cube

rows.description:
If the cube is a full cube then a set of rows containing a tab delimeted set of values.  The number of values in each row will be one per category in the first dimension.
If there is a second dimension then there will be one row for each category in the second dimension.
If there are three dimensions then there will be a set of rows (holding the data for all the cells in dimensions 1 and 2) for each category in dimension 3.

cells.description: If he cube is a sparse cube then there will be a set of cells, each containing a way of indexing the cell in the cube and then the value of that cell.

JobSummary.description: Summary information for a job in FastStats

priority.description: The priority of the job.  The lower the number the more important the job

state.description: The state of the job.  Valid values can include 'cancel', 'done', 'incomplete', 'inserting' and 'unassigned'

cancelRequested.description: Whether this job has been asked to cancel.  If it has then acted on this request and been cancelled then the state will be set to 'cancel'

timeAdded.description: The date and time that the job was added to the job queue

timeSent.description: The date and time that the job was sent from the queue to be processed

timeFinished.description: The date and time that the job finished processing

server.description: The hostname of the server that is processing/processed this job

systemName.description: The name of the FastStats system that this job is running against

threadNumber.description: The number of the thread within the FastStats Service that is running this job

username.description: The name of the user that submitted this job

The URL of the view of the shareable item (specified when the shareable item was created)
will be added to the notification after this message.

viewShareableUrl.description:
A URL of a page to view the shareable item.  If specified this will be used in notification
messages to show added or removed users where to view the shareable item

If the URL is specified, it can use {shareableId} and {emailAddress} parameters

http://www.example.com/collections/{shareableId}?email={emailAddress}

If present, these parameters will be replaced with the id of the shareable item and the email address of the user being added/removed

confirmRegistrationUrl.description:
A URL to send in the notification to the user to allow them to confirm their registration.

If the URL is specified, it can use the {token} parameter:

http://www.example.com/register/{token}

If present, this parameter will be replaced with the token of the registration request, which will be needed when confirming the registration

CreateResetPasswordRequest.description: The parameters needed to create a new reset password request

emailAddress.description: The email address for the user resetting their password

resetPasswordUrl.description:
A URL to send in the notification to the user to allow them to confirm they want to reset their password.

If the URL is specified, it can use the {token}, {emailAddress} and {username} parameters:

http://www.example.com/resetPassword/{token}?email={emailAddress}&username={username}

If present, the {token} parameter will be replaced with the token of the password reset request, which
will be needed when performing the reset.  The {emailAddress} parameter will be replaced with the email address
of the user resetting their password.  The {username} parameter will be replaced with the username of the
user resetting their password.
